## Introduction

This page analyzes changes in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population over time for a specific country using the Gapminder dataset. Here, we focus on the United States to examine long-term development trends from 1952 to 2007.

## Data and Visualization

```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
```

```{r}
gapminder <- read.csv("gapminder.csv")

```

```{r}

country_data <- gapminder %>%
  filter(country == "China")

ggplot(country_data, aes(x = year)) +
  geom_line(aes(y = life_expectancy, color = "Life Expectancy"), linewidth = 1) +
  geom_line(aes(y = gdp_per_capita / 1000, color = "GDP per Capita (÷1000)"), linewidth = 1) +
  geom_line(aes(y = population_millions / 10, color = "Population (÷10)"), linewidth = 1) +
  labs(
    title = "Trends in China (1952–2007)",
    x = "Year",
    y = "Scaled Values",
    color = "Variable"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()
```
